page.title: 09Emma Sims: A Day in Elsworth
page.content: I'm eleven years old and an only child. My mother teaches at Elsworth School and my father works for the British Oxygen Company at Harlow. He leaves about 07.00 and returns at about 19.00. I'm woken up at 07.15. I usually have breakfast in the kitchen and have cereal. I arrive at school at about 08.30 and school starts at 08.55. We begin with assembly as we're a Church School. I play out sometimes on my bike or roller-skates or practise the piano or oboe or guitar or recorder.I usually make a cup of tea for my mum when she comes in from work. We all have our meal together usually. Sometimes we cook it in the microwave. I go to bed at 21.00. My bed is easy to make because I have a duvet.
